meanings.definition: To gain possession of something again.
meanings.sent1: After losing his favorite toy, Tim was thrilled to be reacquiring it.
meanings.sent2: She is reacquiring her old bike from the garage sale.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept reacquiring the same toy every time it got lost.
meanings.sent4: The sun rises every morning, reacquiring its place in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The detective was reacquiring the stolen painting to return it to the museum.

meanings.definition: To obtain or get back something that was previously owned or possessed.
meanings.sent1: The library is reacquiring the books that were borrowed last month.
meanings.sent2: He is reacquiring his lost wallet from the lost and found.
meanings.sent3: The magician kept reacquiring the same coin during his trick.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was reacquiring her freedom after finishing her exams.
meanings.sent5: The company is reacquiring its former employees to boost productivity.
